raw_text:
385
Sarajevo Prva Linija, “A Tragedy That Must Not Be Forgotten :
On The Second Anniversary of the Calvary of the People of Sre
brenica " by Abdulah Suljkanovic, July 1997,
pp
.   26-27 . FBIS
Reston 98E08086B , 2321207 March 1998 .
386 The Washington Post, “ Bosnian Soldiers Evade Serbs in Trudge
to Safety " by John Pomfret, 18 July 1995 .
387 The New   York Times, “ Muslim Refugees Slip Across Serb
Lines ” by Chris Hedges, 18 July 1995 .
388 Halilovic, Sefer, Lukava Strategija ( “ Clever Strategy ” ), chapter
14 .
389 The Christian Science Monitor, “ Bosnian Muslims Were Killed
by the Truckload" by David Rohde, 2 October 1995 .
390 The Washington Post, “ Bosnian Soldiers Evade Serbs in Trudge
to Safety " by John Pomfret, 18 July 1995 .
391 The Washington Post, “Anybody Who Moved or Screamed Was
Killed ” by Michael Dobbs and Christine Spolar, 26 October 1995 .
392 The Washington Post, “ Serbs Start Expelling Muslim Civilians
From   Seized UN Enclave " by John Pomfret, 13 July 1995 .
393 The Christian Science Monitor, " Bosnian Muslims Were Killed
by the Truckload " by David Rohde , 2 October 1995 .
394
Ibid
.
395 The Washington Post, “ Survivor Tells of Brutal Murders ” by
Christine Spolar, 26 October 1995 .
396 The Washington Post, “ Anybody Who Moved or Screamed Was
Killed" by Michael Dobbs and Christine Spolar, 26 October 1995 .
397 The New York Times, “ Srebrenica : The Days of Slaughter " by
Stephen Engelberg and Tim Weiner, with further reporting from
Raymond Bonner and Jane Perlez , 29 October 1995 .
398 The Washington Post, “ Survivor Tells of Brutal Murders ” by
Christine Spolar, 26 October 1995 .
399 The Washington Post, “ Anybody Who Moved or Screamed Was
Killed" by Michael Dobbs and Christine Spolar, 26 October 1995 .
400 London The Times, “ Serbs ‘ Tried to Hide Mass Graves'" by
Stacy Sullivan, 3 April 1996 .
401 The Ottawa Citizen, “Telling Testimony " by Emma Daly,
3 April 1996 .
402 The Christian Science Monitor, “ Bosnian Massacre Sites Swept
of Key Evidence" by David Rohde, 3 April 1996.
403 The New York Times, “ In Bosnia Field , Disturbed Dirt at Suspect
Site" by Mike O'Connor, 3 April 1996.
404 The Miami Herald, “ Investigators Find Signs of Huge Grave in
Bosnian Field " by George Esper, 4 April 1996.
405 The Christian Science Monitor, “ Bosnian Muslims Were Killed
by the Truckload " by David Rohde , 2 October 1995 .
406 The Washington Post, “ US Official Visits Site of ' Sheer Mur
der' " by John Pomfret, 22 January 1996 .
407 This site is also sometimes referred to as the “ Tatar ” mass grave
site .
408 The Christian Science Monitor, “More Mass Graves Found at
Srebrenica " by Jonathan S. Landay, 19 January 1996 .
The Washington Post, “Grim Evidence Points to Muslims '
Graves" by John Pomfret, 19 January 1996 .
410 The Washington Post, “Anybody Who Moved or Screamed Was
Killed ” by Michael Dobbs and Christine Spolar, 26 October 1995 .
411 The Washington Post, “ New Proof Offered of Serb Atrocities "
by Michael Dobbs and R. Jeffrey Smith, 29 October 1995 .
412 USA Today, “New Grave Site Discovered in Bosnia Valley " by
Tom Squitieri, 19 January 1996 .
413 Paris Le Figaro , “ Bosnia —   The Confession of Drazen , War
Criminal" by Renaud Girard , 8 March 1996. FBIS Brussels BE
BR0803153096 , 081530Z March 1996 .
417 The Christian Science Monitor, “ Bosnian Muslims Were Killed
by the Truckload " by David Rohde, 2 October 1995.
418 The New   York Times, "Muslims Tell of Atrocities in Bosnian
Town " by Stephen Kinzer, 14 July 1995.
419 The New   York Times , “ Terrorized Human Tide Overwhelms
Relief Camp” by Stephen Kinzer, 14 July 1995 .
420 The Washington Post, “ Witnesses Allege Abuses by Serbs” by
John Pomfret, 16 July 1995 .
421 The New York Times, “ Bosnian Refugees' Accounts Appear to
Verify Atrocities ” by Stephen Kinzer, 17 July 1995 .
422 See The New   York Times, “ In Bosnian Town Where Thousands
Died , Ethnic Hate Overwhelms Small Kindnesses" by David
Rohde for a description of Srebrenica three years after its takeover
by the Serbs .
423 See The Washington Post, “ Srebrenica Massacre's Uncertain
Legacy” by Michael Dobbs, 7 July 1996 for additional discussion
of this issue .
424 The Washington Post, “ US Official Visits Bosnian Site of Sheer
Murder ” ” by John Pomfret, 22 January 1996 .
425 The Washington Post, “ Bosnian Soldiers Evade Serbs in Trudge
to Safety " by John Pomfret, 18 July 1995 .
426 The Washington Post, “ Dutch Government Absolves Troops in
Fall of Srebrenica " by William Drozdiak , 31 October 1995 .
427 As of 5 August 1994, the UNHCR had registered 35,632 refu
gees who had arrived in Tuzla, Banovici , Srebrenik, Gracanica,
Kladanj , Lukavac , Zivinice , Kalesija, and Brcko. This figure, how
ever, may have included a number of refugees from the Zepa
enclave as well, which had also fallen by this time. Conversely, it
probably omitted most of the surviving members of the ARBiH
28th Division , who proved extremely reluctant to register them
selves with any of the international organizations .
428 Time, “Tears and Terror: Mercilessly, the War Tramples ' Safe
Areas'" by Bruce W. Nelan, 24 July 1995 .
429 Reuters, “Bosnian Enclave Issues Plea for UN Help,” 16 July
1995 .
430 Reuters , “ Akashi Buries Zepa, Says UN Powerless, ” 19 July
1995 .
431 Estimates of the number of civilians in the enclave had ranged as
high as 16,000, but it later appeared that these figures had been
inaccurate or inflated. Reuters, “ Zepa Almost Empty of Civilians
-UN,” 28 July 1995 .
432 The 1st Podrinje Light Infantry Brigade from Rogatica and the
5th Podrinje Light Infantry Brigade from Visegrad usually contrib
uted about a battalion each to the tactical group. For details on the
VRS order of battle, see ICTY Krstic trial transcripts from
28-30 June 2000 .
433 Reuters , “ Bosnian Serbs Threaten Attack— Bosnian Govern
ment,” 14 July 1995. See ICTY Krstic trial transcripts for
28-30 June 2000 .
434 The Washington Post, “ Bosnian Serbs Strike At Second ‘Safe
Area ' " by Samantha Power, 15 July 1995 .
435 Reuters, “ Bosnian Serbs ' Target’ UN Posts at Zepa Enclave, ”
14 July 1995 .
436 Reuters , “ Bosnian Serbs Attack Zepa Despite NATO Air
Cover,” 14 July 1995 .
437 Reuters, “NATO Flying Blind Over Zepa,” 17 July 1995 .
438 Reuters, “ Bosnian Serb Attack on Zepa Subsides—UN ," 14 July
1995 .
Reuters , “ Bosnian Serbs Shell Zepa Town, Renew Assault,"
14 July 1995 .
440 Reuters , “ Bosnian Serb Push into Zepa—UN ,” 14 July 1995 .
441 Reuters , “ Bosnian Army Takes Ukrainian Guns in Enclave, ”
15 July 1995 .
a
409
439
414
Ibid
.
415 The New Straits Times, “ Too Little , Too Late for Srebrenica" by
David Rohde, 26 January 1998 .
416 The Sunday Telegraph, “ Killing Fields of Srebrenica" by Gaby
Rado, 22 October 1995 .
409
